intro: Pyrenacantha chlorantha, commonly known as the green thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces follicles containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a waxy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils in semi-arid environments. Pyrenacantha chlorantha is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
